head.citation-title: Color image adaptive watermarking algorithm based on fractional quaternion Fourier transform and genetic algorithm
head.abstracts: © 2017, Editorial Department of Journal of Southeast University. All right reserved.A new color image adaptive watermarking algorithm is proposed based on the fractional quaternion Fourier transform (FrQFT) and the genetic algorithm. First, the image blocks are classified into three types according to the masking properties of texture, edge and color tone directly extracted from the color host image. The adaptive watermarking strength value of each block is determined by the corresponding Richard curve. And the parameters of the Richard curves are optimized by the genetic algorithm with the consideration of the invisibility and the robustness. Finally, according to the adaptive watermarking strength values decided by the optimized Richard curves, the watermarks are inserted into the FrQFT coefficients of the color host image by using the quantization index modulation algorithm and the redundant embedding strategy. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed algorithm outperforms some existing conventional algorithms and some existing quaternion-based algorithms in terms of the invisibility and the robustness.
